ForearmsLVRadialFlexion.name: Lever Radial Deviation
ForearmsLVRadialFlexion.preparation: Rotate handle under and over so handle is in slightly upward position toward head. Grasp handle with thumb ups grip so thumb side of fist is pulled away under resistance.
ForearmsLVRadialFlexion.execution: Bend wrist so thumb side of fist is pulled up. Return to starting position and repeat.

ForearmsLVReverseWristCurl.name: Lever Reverse Wrist Curl
ForearmsLVReverseWristCurl.preparation: Grasp handles with overhand grip to each side. Place forearms on arm pads.
ForearmsLVReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise handles until wrist is fully hyperextended. Lower handles until wrists are fully flexed. Repeat.
ForearmsLVReverseWristCurl.comments: Keep forearms horizontal, flat on arm pads throughout exercise. See reverse wrist curl up close.

ForearmsLVRollerWristExtention.name: Lever Roller Wrist Extension
ForearmsLVRollerWristExtention.comments: Also see Lever Roller Wrist Flexion.

ForearmsLVRollerRadialFlexion.name: Lever Roller Radial Deviation
ForearmsLVRollerRadialFlexion.preparation: Place hands on knobs at each end of roller.
ForearmsLVRollerRadialFlexion.execution: With left hand gripping knob, relax grip of right hand and slide grip downward so fingers are under bottom of knob (by ulnar deviation) and regrip. Relax grip of left hand and rotate knob with right hand so thumb travels closer to body (by radial deviation). Repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. Lower weight steadily with opposite movement or loosen grip slightly to control descent of weight stack.
ForearmsLVRollerRadialFlexion.comments: Exercise is performed on specialized piece of equipment which includes knobs at each end of wrist roller.
